question: Who prophesied about the coming Messiah being born in Bethlehem?
explanation: Micah prophesied that the Messiah would be born in Bethlehem, the city of David.

verses.kjv:
But thou, Bethlehem Ephratah,
though thou be little among the thousands of Judah,
yet out of thee shall he come forth unto me
that is to be ruler in Israel; whose goings forth
have been
 from of old, from everlasting.

question: Which prophet had a vision of the valley of dry bones coming to life?
explanation: Ezekiel saw a vision of dry bones coming together and being filled with breath, representing Israel's restoration.

verses.kjv:
The hand of the LORD was upon me, and carried me out in the spirit of the LORD, and set me down in the midst of the valley which
was full of bones,
And caused me to pass by them round about: and, behold,
there were
 very many in the open valley; and, lo,
they were very dry.
And he said unto me, Son of man, can these bones live? And I answered, O Lord GOD, thou knowest.
Again he said unto me, Prophesy upon these bones, and say unto them, O ye dry bones, hear the word of the LORD.
Thus saith the Lord GOD unto these bones; Behold, I will cause breath to enter into you, and ye shall live:
And I will lay sinews upon you, and will bring up flesh upon you, and cover you with skin, and put breath in you, and ye shall live; and ye shall know that I
am the LORD.
So I prophesied as I was commanded: and as I prophesied, there was a noise, and behold a shaking, and the bones came together, bone to his bone.
And when I beheld, lo, the sinews and the flesh came up upon them, and the skin covered them above: but
there was
no breath in them.
Then said he unto me, Prophesy unto the wind, prophesy, son of man, and say to the wind, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Come from the four winds, O breath, and breathe upon these slain, that they may live.
So I prophesied as he commanded me, and the breath came into them, and they lived, and stood up upon their feet, an exceeding great army.
Then he said unto me, Son of man, these bones are the whole house of Israel: behold, they say, Our bones are dried, and our hope is lost: we are cut off for our parts.
Therefore prophesy and say unto them, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, O my people, I will open your graves, and cause you to come up out of your graves, and bring you into the land of Israel.
And ye shall know that I
am the LORD, when I have opened your graves, O my people, and brought you up out of your graves,
And shall put my spirit in you, and ye shall live, and I shall place you in your own land: then shall ye know that I the LORD have spoken
it,
 and performed
it, saith the LORD.

question: Which prophet confronted King David about his sin with Bathsheba?
explanation: Nathan told David a parable about a rich man and a poor man, then declared 'You are the man!'

verses.kjv:
And Nathan said to David, Thou
art the man. Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, I anointed thee king over Israel, and I delivered thee out of the hand of Saul;

question: Who prophesied about a suffering servant who would bear our sins?
explanation: Isaiah prophesied about the suffering servant who was pierced for our transgressions and crushed for our iniquities.

verses.kjv:
But he
was wounded for our transgressions,
he was
 bruised for our iniquities: the chastisement of our peace
was
 upon him; and with his stripes we are healed.

question: What miraculous sign did Elisha perform with an axe head?
explanation: When an axe head fell into the water, Elisha threw a stick in and made the iron float.

verses.kjv:
And the man of God said, Where fell it? And he shewed him the place. And he cut down a stick, and cast
it in thither; and the iron did swim.

question: How many false prophets did Elijah challenge on Mount Carmel?
explanation: Elijah alone faced 450 prophets of Baal in a contest to prove who was the true God.

verses.kjv:
Then said Elijah unto the people, I,
even I only, remain a prophet of the LORD; but Baalâ€™s prophets
are four hundred and fifty men.

question: What did God tell Ezekiel to eat to symbolize receiving His word?
explanation: God commanded Ezekiel to eat a scroll, which tasted as sweet as honey, symbolizing ingesting God's word.

verses.kjv: Moreover he said unto me, Son of man, eat that thou findest; eat this roll, and go speak unto the house of Israel.

question: Which prophet was thrown into a cistern for his prophecies?
explanation: Officials threw Jeremiah into a cistern where he sank into the mud because of his prophecies.

verses.kjv:
Then took they Jeremiah, and cast him into the dungeon of Malchiah the son of Hammelech, that
was in the court of the prison: and they let down Jeremiah with cords. And in the dungeon
there was no water, but mire: so Jeremiah sunk in the mire.

question: What did God tell Jeremiah he was before he was born?
choices: Set apart as a prophet to the nations
explanation: Before I formed you in the womb I knew you, and set you apart as a prophet to the nations.

verses.kjv:
Before I formed thee in the belly I knew thee; and before thou camest forth out of the womb I sanctified thee,
and I ordained thee a prophet unto the nations.

question: Which prophet said 'Woe is me, for I am undone'?
explanation: When Isaiah saw the Lord in the temple, he cried out about his unworthiness.

verses.kjv:
Then said I, Woe
is me! for I am undone; because I
am
 a man of unclean lips, and I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips: for mine eyes have seen the King, the LORD of hosts.

question: What did the angel touch to Isaiah's lips?
explanation: A seraphim touched Isaiah's mouth with a live coal from the altar to atone for his sin.

verses.kjv:
Then flew one of the seraphims unto me, having a live coal in his hand,
which he had taken with the tongs from off the altar:
And he laid
it upon my mouth, and said, Lo, this hath touched thy lips; and thine iniquity is taken away, and thy sin purged.

question: Which prophet saw a wheel within a wheel?
explanation: Ezekiel saw four wheels, and their appearance was like a wheel intersecting a wheel.

verses.kjv:
The appearance of the wheels and their work
was like unto the colour of a beryl: and they four had one likeness: and their appearance and their work was as it were a wheel in the middle of a wheel.

question: Who prophesied about the valley of dry bones?
explanation: The hand of the Lord was on Ezekiel, and he brought him out by the Spirit to the middle of a valley full of bones.

verses.kjv:
The hand of the LORD was upon me, and carried me out in the spirit of the LORD, and set me down in the midst of the valley which
was full of bones,

question: Who prophesied that a virgin would conceive?
explanation: Therefore the Lord himself will give you a sign: The virgin will conceive and give birth to a son.

verses.kjv: Therefore the Lord himself shall give you a sign; Behold, a virgin shall conceive, and bear a son, and shall call his name Immanuel.

question: Which prophet saw a vision of dry bones coming to life?
explanation: Ezekiel prophesied to the dry bones and they came to life, representing God's promise to restore Israel.

verses.kjv: So I prophesied as he commanded me, and the breath came into them, and they lived, and stood up upon their feet, an exceeding great army.

question: Which prophet married a prostitute as a symbol of Israel's unfaithfulness?
explanation: God commanded Hosea to marry Gomer, a prostitute, to illustrate Israel's spiritual adultery.

verses.kjv:
The beginning of the word of the LORD by Hosea. And the LORD said to Hosea, Go, take unto thee a wife of whoredoms and children of whoredoms: for the land hath committed great whoredom,
departing from the LORD.

question: Who prophesied from inside a cistern where he was thrown?
explanation: Jeremiah was thrown into a muddy cistern for prophesying Jerusalem's fall, but was later rescued.

verses.kjv:
Then took they Jeremiah, and cast him into the dungeon of Malchiah the son of Hammelech, that
was in the court of the prison: and they let down Jeremiah with cords. And in the dungeon
there was no water, but mire: so Jeremiah sunk in the mire.

question: What did Ezekiel eat that tasted like honey?
explanation: So I ate the scroll, and it tasted as sweet as honey in my mouth.

verses.kjv:
And he said unto me, Son of man, cause thy belly to eat, and fill thy bowels with this roll that I give thee. Then did I eat
it; and it was in my mouth as honey for sweetness.

question: Which prophet saw chariots of fire and horses of fire?
explanation: Elisha prayed, and the Lord opened the servant's eyes, and he saw horses and chariots of fire.

verses.kjv:
And Elisha prayed, and said, LORD, I pray thee, open his eyes, that he may see. And the LORD opened the eyes of the young man; and he saw: and, behold, the mountain
was full of horses and chariots of fire round about Elisha.

question: Which prophet struck the Jordan River with Elijah's cloak?
explanation: Elisha struck the water with Elijah's cloak and the water divided, and he crossed over.

verses.kjv:
And he took the mantle of Elijah that fell from him, and smote the waters, and said, Where
is the LORD God of Elijah? and when he also had smitten the waters, they parted hither and thither: and Elisha went over.

question: Which prophet was commanded to marry an adulterous woman?
explanation: The Lord said to Hosea, 'Go, marry a promiscuous woman and have children with her, for like an adulterous wife this land is guilty of unfaithfulness.'

verses.kjv:
The beginning of the word of the LORD by Hosea. And the LORD said to Hosea, Go, take unto thee a wife of whoredoms and children of whoredoms: for the land hath committed great whoredom,
departing from the LORD.

question: Which prophet confronted King Ahab about Naboth's vineyard?
explanation: Ahab said to Elijah, 'So you have found me, my enemy!' 'I have found you,' he answered, 'because you have sold yourself to do evil.'

verses.kjv:
And Ahab said to Elijah, Hast thou found me, O mine enemy? And he answered, I have found
thee: because thou hast sold thyself to work evil in the sight of the LORD.

question: Which prophet had a vision of four great beasts?
explanation: Four great beasts, each different from the others, came up out of the sea.

verses.kjv: And four great beasts came up from the sea, diverse one from another.

question: Which prophet saw the Lord sitting on a throne, high and exalted?
explanation: In the year that King Uzziah died, I saw the Lord, high and exalted, seated on a throne.

verses.kjv: In the year that king Uzziah died I saw also the Lord sitting upon a throne, high and lifted up, and his train filled the temple.

question: Which prophet received double the spirit that was on Elijah?
explanation: When they had crossed, Elijah said to Elisha, 'Tell me, what can I do for you before I am taken from you?' 'Let me inherit a double portion of your spirit,' Elisha replied.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when they were gone over, that Elijah said unto Elisha, Ask what I shall do for thee, before I be taken away from thee. And Elisha said, I pray thee, let a double portion of thy spirit be upon me.

question: Which prophet prophesied the birth of Jesus in Bethlehem?
explanation: But you, Bethlehem Ephrathah, though you are small among the clans of Judah, out of you will come for me one who will be ruler over Israel.

verses.kjv:
But thou, Bethlehem Ephratah,
though thou be little among the thousands of Judah,
yet out of thee shall he come forth unto me
that is to be ruler in Israel; whose goings forth
have been
 from of old, from everlasting.

question: Which prophet's wife was named Gomer?
explanation: So he married Gomer daughter of Diblaim, and she conceived and bore him a son.

verses.kjv: So he went and took Gomer the daughter of Diblaim; which conceived, and bare him a son.

question: Which prophet was told to marry a prostitute as a sign to Israel?
explanation: The Lord said to Hosea, 'Go, marry a promiscuous woman' to illustrate Israel's unfaithfulness to God.

verses.kjv:
The beginning of the word of the LORD by Hosea. And the LORD said to Hosea, Go, take unto thee a wife of whoredoms and children of whoredoms: for the land hath committed great whoredom,
departing from the LORD.

question: Which prophet's sons said, "The spirit of Elijah doth rest on Elisha"?
explanation: After Elijah was taken up, the sons of the prophets recognized that Elijah's spirit rested on Elisha.

verses.kjv: And when the sons of the prophets which were to view at Jericho saw him, they said, The spirit of Elijah doth rest on Elisha. And they came to meet him, and bowed themselves to the ground before him.

question: When Elisha struck the waters with Elijah's mantle, what happened to the Jordan?
choices: It became dry for seven days
explanation: Elisha smote the waters, and the Jordan divided, allowing him to cross.

verses.kjv: And he took the mantle of Elijah that fell from him, and smote the waters, and said, Where is the LORD God of Elijah? and when he also had smitten the waters, they parted hither and thither: and Elisha went over.

question: Which prophet was instructed to take a potter's earthen bottle and elders with him?
explanation: The LORD told Jeremiah to take an earthen bottle and some of the elders.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, Go and get a potter's earthen bottle, and take of the ancients of the people, and of the ancients of the priests;

question: Which prophet said, "My children are gone forth of me, and they are not"?
explanation: Jeremiah records this lament about the tabernacle being spoiled and children gone.

verses.kjv: My tabernacle is spoiled, and all my cords are broken: my children are gone forth of me, and they are not: there is none to stretch forth my tent any more, and to set up my curtains.

question: Which prophet said, "Thy lovers will I give into his hand"?
explanation: In Ezekiel 16, the LORD speaks of gathering those with whom Jerusalem had sinned and giving her into their hand.

verses.kjv: Behold, therefore I will gather all thy lovers, with whom thou hast taken pleasure, and all them that thou hast loved, with all them that thou hast hated; I will even gather them round about against thee, and will discover thy nakedness unto them, that they may see all thy nakedness.

question: In Ezekiel's vision, what did the LORD say would happen when the spirit entered the prophet?
choices: He was lifted above the clouds
explanation: Ezekiel says the spirit entered him and set him upon his feet.

verses.kjv: And the spirit entered into me when he spake unto me, and set me upon my feet, that I heard him that spake unto me.

question: Which prophet saw a hand that wrote on a wall in the king's palace?
explanation: Daniel 5 describes the fingers of a man's hand writing on the wall during Belshazzar's feast.

verses.kjv: In the same hour came forth fingers of a man's hand, and wrote over against the candlestick upon the plaister of the wall of the king's palace: and the king saw the part of the hand that wrote.

question: Which prophet said, "Open thou mine eyes, that I may see"?
explanation: Elisha prayed that the LORD would open the young man's eyes to see the spiritual army around them.

verses.kjv: And Elisha prayed, and said, LORD, I pray thee, open his eyes, that he may see. And the LORD opened the eyes of the young man; and he saw: and, behold, the mountain was full of horses and chariots of fire round about Elisha.

question: Which prophet prayed for a young man's eyes to be opened to see horses and chariots of fire?
explanation: Elisha prayed, and the LORD opened the young man's eyes to see horses and chariots of fire.

verses.kjv: And Elisha prayed, and said, LORD, I pray thee, open his eyes, that he may see. And the LORD opened the eyes of the young man; and he saw: and, behold, the mountain was full of horses and chariots of fire round about Elisha.

question: According to Isaiah, what did the seraphim cry one unto another?
choices: Holy, holy, holy, is the LORD of hosts: the whole earth is full of his glory
Woe, woe, woe, unto the nations
Blessed be the name of the king
explanation: Isaiah records the seraphim proclaiming God's holiness and glory.

verses.kjv: And one cried unto another, and said, Holy, holy, holy, is the LORD of hosts: the whole earth is full of his glory.

question: According to Isaiah, what did one of the seraphim take from off the altar?
explanation: Isaiah says a seraphim flew to him with a live coal taken from the altar with tongs.

verses.kjv: Then flew one of the seraphims unto me, having a live coal in his hand, which he had taken with the tongs from off the altar:

question: In Isaiah, what did the live coal touch to take away iniquity and purge sin?
explanation: Isaiah says the coal touched his mouth, and his iniquity was taken away.

verses.kjv: And he laid it upon my mouth, and said, Lo, this hath touched thy lips; and thine iniquity is taken away, and thy sin purged.

question: Which prophet said, "Behold, I will do a new thing"?
explanation: Isaiah records the LORD saying He will do a new thing and make a way in the wilderness.

verses.kjv: Behold, I will do a new thing; now it shall spring forth; shall ye not know it? I will even make a way in the wilderness, and rivers in the desert.

question: Which prophet wrote, "A bruised reed shall he not break"?
explanation: Isaiah 42:3 describes the LORD's servant as gentle toward the weak.

verses.kjv: A bruised reed shall he not break, and the smoking flax shall he not quench: he shall bring forth judgment unto truth.

question: Which prophet said, "Fear not: for I have redeemed thee"?
explanation: Isaiah records God telling Israel not to fear because He has redeemed them and called them by name.

verses.kjv: But now thus saith the LORD that created thee, O Jacob, and he that formed thee, O Israel, Fear not: for I have redeemed thee, I have called thee by thy name; thou art mine.

question: Which prophet wrote that the word of the LORD was "as a burning fire shut up in my bones"?
explanation: Jeremiah said he could not keep silent because God's word was like a burning fire in his bones.

verses.kjv: Then I said, I will not make mention of him, nor speak any more in his name. But his word was in mine heart as a burning fire shut up in my bones, and I was weary with forbearing, and I could not stay.

question: Which prophet was told to go down to the potter's house to hear God's words?
explanation: God commanded Jeremiah to go to the potter's house where He would cause him to hear His words.

verses.kjv: Arise, and go down to the potter's house, and there I will cause thee to hear my words.

question: According to Jeremiah, who is like clay in the potter's hand?
explanation: The LORD compares Israel to clay, saying they are in His hand like clay in the potter's hand.

verses.kjv: O house of Israel, cannot I do with you as this potter? saith the LORD. Behold, as the clay is in the potter's hand, so are ye in mine hand, O house of Israel.

question: In Ezekiel's vision, what did the prophet say was "as the colour of amber"?
choices: The likeness of a man upon the throne
The river flowing from the temple
explanation: Ezekiel describes the appearance of the likeness of a man upon the throne as having the colour of amber.

verses.kjv: And above the firmament that was over their heads was the likeness of a throne, as the appearance of a sapphire stone: and upon the likeness of the throne was the likeness as the appearance of a man above upon it. And I saw as the colour of amber, as the appearance of fire round about within it, from the appearance of his loins even upward, and from the appearance of his loins even downward, I saw as it were the appearance of fire, and it had brightness round about.

question: In Daniel, what was written in the king's dream on the wall?
explanation: Daniel says the writing was MENE, MENE, TEKEL, UPHARSIN.

verses.kjv: And this is the writing that was written, MENE, MENE, TEKEL, UPHARSIN.

question: Which prophet said, "The LORD is good, a strong hold in the day of trouble"?
explanation: Nahum declares the LORD is good and knows them that trust in Him.

verses.kjv: The LORD is good, a strong hold in the day of trouble; and he knoweth them that trust in him.

question: Which prophet said, "Behold upon the mountains the feet of him that bringeth good tidings"?
explanation: Nahum speaks of good tidings and peace, calling Judah to keep feasts and perform vows.

verses.kjv: Behold upon the mountains the feet of him that bringeth good tidings, that publisheth peace! O Judah, keep thy solemn feasts, perform thy vows: for the wicked shall no more pass through thee; he is utterly cut off.
